events.name: Level
events.comment: Check what level the player is on.

events.name: DebugMode
events.comment: Enables special features only meant for testing.

events.name: CanPause
events.comment: If set to 1. Player can pause the game while 0 makes it so you cannot pause the game.

events.text: this doesn't matter here but probably works if time attack exists

events.name: CurrentHP
events.comment: dont set anywhere under 1 or else shit will break lmao

events.name: ShowHud
events.comment: You can tell what this does by the variable name

events.name: CamLockArea
events.comment: Not used yet. Might change how it will work from the old code

events.name: ChangeSmoothest
events.comment: Setting the value over 1 will not make the camera Smooth anymore. Setting the Value to 0 will force the camera to not move anymore

events.name: FollowPlayer
events.comment: (Use the Camera Object instead) Makes the camera follow the player (1 = ON / 0 = OFF)

children.title: Pa_Menu Debug
children.description: Shows up if Debug Mode is enabled

parameters.text:
"Resume

Retry Level

Quit to Menu

Debug Menu"

"Player X: "& Player1.X & "
Player Y: "& Player1.Y & "

Camera X " & Camera.X & "
Camera Y " & Camera.Y & " 
Cam.M Speed: " & Camera.MoveTo.MaxSpeed & "
Camera Offset: " & Camera.CameraXTimer & "

Player Speed: "& Player1.Platform.Speed & "
Player MAX-Speed: " & Player1.Platform.MaxSpeed & "
Player X Vector: " & Player1.Platform.VectorX & "
Player Y Vector: " & Player1.Platform.VectorY & "
Player A-State: " & Player1.AnimationState & "
Player A-Rem: " & Player1.AnimationRem & "
Player Anim: " & Player1.AnimationName & "
Run Timer: " & Player1.TimertilRunning & "
Water: " & Player1.InWater

actions.text: makes sure these are on the correct set values because construct can revert them to the default platform values.

children.title: Player Movement/Animation
children.description: Movement guys come on. (also probably full up with ALOT of duck-tape. im sorry.)

children.text:
Standing on a object that has the JumpThru Behavior breaks the starting animation for some reason. However by spin jumping and landing on a JumpThru Object fixes this problem??

Need to figure out this bug since this also stops the player from starting to run sometimes aswell.

update: i figured it out. it was the falling animation hitbox causing it. 

Another bug is with WalkThru Slopes. While they do work fine. Trying to walk on them while max running or if holding a item will make Mario walk through for whatever reason... 
I'm guessing this COULD BE a Construct problem but i'm not quite sure here.
fixes a bug where u couldn't start speeding up while jumping, falling or spinning. feels accurate to SMW
MIGHT redo this so it goes UP back to 90 instead of just going to 90.
fixes being able to even pause the game right after you die.
events i need to find a goot spot to put lol

children.title: Timer System
children.description: Use the TimerSystem Object if you need to change something.

parameters.text:
"Coins: " & Coins & "
HP: " & Player1.HP & "/" & Player1.MaxHP & "
Time: " & TimerSystem.Minutes & ":" & zeropad(TimerSystem.Seconds,2)

"Coins: " & Coins & "
HP: " & Player1.HP & "/" & Player1.MaxHP & "  Combo: " & Player1.EnemyCombo & "
Time: " & TimerSystem.Minutes & ":" & zeropad(TimerSystem.Seconds,2)
